content:
Wonderful! Restorative yoga is a great way to relax and rejuvenate, and following along with a guided class or online resource can be super helpful.

Here are some popular guided restorative yoga classes and online resources that you can follow along with at home:

**Guided Restorative Yoga Classes:**

1. **YogaGlo**: Offers a variety of restorative yoga classes, including classes specifically designed for stress relief, lower back pain, and relaxation.
2. **DoYouYoga**: Features restorative yoga classes with experienced instructors, including classes focused on gentle stretching, relaxation, and rejuvenation.
3. **Gaia**: Offers a range of restorative yoga classes, including classes on stress relief, sleep, and relaxation, taught by experienced instructors.

**Online Resources:**

1. **Restorative Yoga with Adriene**: Adriene offers a range of free restorative yoga videos on her YouTube channel, including classes for relaxation, stress relief, and lower back pain.
2. **Yoga International**: Offers a variety of restorative yoga classes, articles, and tutorials on their website, including classes for beginners and those with specific health concerns.
3. **Restorative Yoga with Jillian Pransky**: Jillian offers restorative yoga classes, workshops, and online courses on her website, focusing on gentle, therapeutic yoga for relaxation and rejuvenation.

**Apps:**

1. **Down Dog**: Offers a variety of restorative yoga classes and sequences, including classes for relaxation, stress relief, and lower back pain.
2. **Pocket Yoga**: Features a range of restorative yoga classes and sequences, including classes for beginners and those with specific health concerns.

**Books and DVDs:**

1. **"Relax and Renew" by Judith Hanson Lasater**: A comprehensive guide to restorative yoga, including sequences, poses, and breathing techniques for relaxation and rejuvenation.
2. **"Restorative Yoga" by Gail Boorstein Grossman**: A detailed guide to restorative yoga, including sequences, poses, and breathing techniques for relaxation, stress relief, and improved sleep.

Remember to always listen to your body and modify or come out of the pose if you experience any discomfort or pain. It's also a good idea to consult with a healthcare professional or yoga therapist before starting a new exercise routine, especially if you have any underlying health conditions.

I hope this helps you get started with restorative yoga at home!
